title: Driven: The Race to Create the Autonomous Car
author: Alex Davies
altText: Yellow book cover with tire tracks.
description: The self-driving car has been one of the most vaunted technological breakthroughs of recent years. But early promises that these autonomous vehicles would soon be on the roads have proven premature.

title: If Then
author: Jill Lepore
altText: Modern design, cream background, thin blocks in motion; title, author, NY Times quote;
description: A revelatory account of the Cold War origins of the data-mad, algorithmic twenty-first century, from the author of the acclaimed international bestseller These Truths.

title: The Hype Machine
author: Sinan Aral
altText: White square shaped book with hype in capitals and a blue smudge in the background
description: A landmark insiderâ€™s tour of how social media affects our decision-making and shapes our world in ways both useful and dangerous, with critical insights into the social media trends of the 2020 election and beyond

title: Predict and Surveil
author: Sarah Brayne
altText: Birds eye view of people spread out and a red sqaure around a targeted small group.
description: The scope of criminal justice surveillance has expanded rapidly in recent decades. At the same time, the use of big data has spread across a range of fields, including finance, politics, healthcare, and marketing.
